title: Stage profiles
text:
Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



The sprinters say they have a chance, but good luck fellas. That final climb is hard, so expect the first yellow to go to a climby sprinty type.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



The sprinters say they have a chance, but good luck fellas. That final climb is hard, so expect the first yellow to go to a climby sprinty type.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 2







Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



With the basque start the front end of this tour is loaded with short steep climbs. This stage is hard to predict, as the final climb isn’t so steep and summits out 18km from the finish. A reduced group sprint perhaps?

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 3







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



First chance for the pure sprinters. Expect lead-out train carnage.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 4







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



Another one for the fast men. Cavs here, but his team sucks. Can he overtake Mercx for most Tour stage wins of all time?

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 5







Terrain type



Large mountain








Zings summary



Pyrenees time aka Pog land. This is a carbon copy of that stage in 2020 where Pog got his first TDF win. Back then, he droppped everyone on the final climb, they caught him on the 7km of flat valley before the finish, but he went and won the sprint anyway.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 6







Terrain type



Extreme mountain








Zings summary



The Tourmalet is the most famous climb in the Pyrenees. After an exceptionally hard first week, expect there to be large gc gaps. If one rider looks superior in this first week, the tour could very possibly already be over after this stage.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 7







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



The sprinters are back baby. Get some sleep if you’ve committed some late night hours the past few days.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 8







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



More pure sprinting.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 9







Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



Apparently the summit finish is up a dormant volcano. So far, this tour seems to be gc days or sprinting days with no inbetween. RIP breakaway chances.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 10







Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



I’ve gone early. This has breakaway written all over it. Wouldn’t suprise me if the team holding yellow lets a break get 15 mins on this stage, maybe even to purposely lose the jersey for a few days.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 11







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



One more for the sprinters. There’s actually far more pure sprinting days than there was last year…

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 12







Terrain type



Medium mountain








Zings summary



Get in the break fellas.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 13







Terrain type



Large mountain








Zings summary



Our first foray into the alps. Grand Colombier is harder than 7% avg grade suggests. This is a Jonas 2022 climb.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 14







Terrain type



Extreme mountain








Zings summary



Big kilajoules day before the final climb and descent. Kilajoules burnt positively correlates with gc gaps so circle this one on the calendar.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 15







Terrain type



Large mountain








Zings summary



I have no idea what will happen here. None of the climbs are extremely hard but god there’s a lot of them. Climby breakaway win? Pog didn’t let those happen last year.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 16







Terrain type



Mountain time trial








Zings summary



The only TT of the race and its full of climbing. Assuming they’re relevant at all, this is the day Mikel Landa and Enrique Mas die (sorry Spain).

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 17







Terrain type



Queen stage (stupid mountains)








Zings summary



One of those ‘must watch live’ stages. Col de la Loze was first used in the 2020 tour. Rog and Sepp dropped Pogi on that day and we all thought Rog had won the tour. This time, I think Pogi actually loses the Tour today. This might be the hardest climb in France.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 18







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



If they’ve survived the previous stage, this will be one for the sprinters.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 19







Terrain type



Miscellaneous








Zings summary



I feel like the peloton will not give a fuck about this stage. One for blokes in the break.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 20







Terrain type



Large mountains








Zings summary



The final battle for yellow and the dots. Plenty of raid potential. If the time gaps are close this could be awesome.

title: Stage profiles
text:
Stage 21







Terrain type



Flat








Zings summary



Champs time. Hopefully your sprinter didn’t OTL. If Jonas makes it here, I can’t see it being in anything other than Yellow.

title: The scoring system
text:
Stage
1st = 10
2nd = 6
3rd = 4
4th = 2
5th = 1
A day in the jersey
Yellow = 10
Green = 5
Polka dots = 5
White = 5
Miscellaneous
For every 50km in the front group (break) = 1
Lanterne rouge = 10



GC
1st = 25
2nd = 22
3rd = 20
4th = 18
5th = 16
6-7th = 14
8th = 12
9-10th = 10
11-12th = 8
13-15th = 6



Green jersey
1st = 10
2nd = 8
3rd = 6
KOM jersey
1st = 10
2nd = 6
3rd = 4
Most combative
1st on each stage = 10
